verb.description: Ask for or obtain (something) without paying for it.
examples: a bunch of your friends will show up, mooching food
I'm mooching off you all the time

verb.description: Loiter in a bored or listless manner.
examples: he didn't want them mooching around all day
the mooch who got everything from his dad

origin: Late Middle English (in the sense to hoard): probably from Old French muchier ( Anglo-Norman muscher) hide, skulk: compare with mitch. Current senses date from the mid 19th century.
